result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Absolute sobriety.  May not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages.  May not enter any premises licensed for the sale or service of alcohol except for employment purposes.

3:32 PM - cases called - 22CF90 (tracking), 22CF95 (tracking), 22CF139.  Defendant Mercadys A Perkins appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney John Zich in court for Mercadys A Perkins.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding this matters.  Court questions Atty Zich/Defendant.  Responses by Atty Zich/Defendant.  Defendant has signed a wavier form.  Court finds the waiver of the preliminary hearing is free and voluntary.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed with the Court.  In receipt - waive reading - plea of not guilty.  Court accepts not guilty plea.  Statement by Atty Zich regarding request for bond modification in 22CF95.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

9:43 AM - cases called - 22CF90, 22CF95 and 22CF139.  Defendant Mercadys A Perkins appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney John Zich appeared in court.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State is not ready to proceed with the preliminary hearing in 22CF139 - officer was not noticed.  Atty Zich does not object to an adjournment in 22CF139.  Court grants request for adjournment.  Court questions Atty Zich regarding bond motion in 22CF95.  State is not opposed to lowering the cash bond in 22CF95.  Court questions Atty Zich.  Response by Atty Zich.  Court questions Defendant's boyfriend. Responses by Defendant's boyfriend.  Statement by the Court.  Court lowers the cash bond in 22CF95 to $1,500.00 with the same conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
